🧩 How to Run Multiple Eudemons Server in VPS

Home

📦 What this page covers

This quick guide shows how to set up multiple Eudemons (JinClassic) servers on a single Windows VPS.

✅ Requirements (recommended)

  • Windows VPS (Windows Server 2008 R2 / 2012+), Administrator access.
  • Drive C:\ with at least 20 GB free space.

📥 Downloads

Server Files

Download MultipleClassicServer

Password : DuaSelipar

Client

Download Jin Classic Client

Password : DuaSelipar

🗂️ Step 1 — Extract the server pack into C:\

  1. Download MultipleClassicServer.rar to your VPS.
  2. Right‑click the archive → Extract Here (or extract directly to C:\).
  3. Check the folder structure looks like this:

Expected path after extraction:

C:\MultipleClassicServer\
├─ AutoPatchJin
├─ Database
├─ JinClassic1
├─ JinClassic2
├─ JinClassic3
├─ JinClassic4
├─ JinClassic5
├─ JinClassic6
├─ JinClassic7
├─ JinClassic8
├─ JinClassic9
├─ JinClassic10
├─ Map File.zip
└─ oem.dat

🗄️ Step 2 — Start MySQL 4 Manager and the database

  1. Go to C:\MultipleClassicServer\Database\.
  2. Launch MySQL 4 Manager.exe.
  3. Click Start to start the MySQL service.

🗺️ Step 3 — Extract the map files

  1. Open Map File.zip provided in the pack.
  2. Extract its contents (ini, map, PuzzleSave) into every GameServer folder.
  3. When prompted, choose Replace/Overwrite.

Target folders:

C:\MultipleClassicServer\JinClassic1\GameServer\
C:\MultipleClassicServer\JinClassic2\GameServer\
C:\MultipleClassicServer\JinClassic3\GameServer\
C:\MultipleClassicServer\JinClassic4\GameServer\
C:\MultipleClassicServer\JinClassic5\GameServer\
C:\MultipleClassicServer\JinClassic6\GameServer\
C:\MultipleClassicServer\JinClassic7\GameServer\
C:\MultipleClassicServer\JinClassic8\GameServer\
C:\MultipleClassicServer\JinClassic9\GameServer\
C:\MultipleClassicServer\JinClassic10\GameServer\

One archive is used for all servers due to storage limits.

⚙️ Step 4 — EasySetupEO (per GameServer)

  1. Open EasySetupEO.exe inside each GameServer folder.
  2. Server Name: set your server name.
  3. Server IP:
    • Local — 127.0.0.1, solo play.
    • LAN — play within your local network.
    • External — play online (public IP/DNS).
  4. Server Port:
    • Login Port — you can change this.
    • MSG Port — ignore and do not change.
    • NPC Port — you can change this.
  5. Database Connection: ignore if not needed.
  6. Click Save when finished.

🟢 Step 5 — Start the servers (Auto Maintenance Tool)

  1. Open AutoMaintTool in each server folder you want to run.
  2. Click Open Config to select which services to manage, then Save.
  3. Click Start to begin the auto-maintenance cycle, or use Manual Start/Manual Stop for immediate control.
    4. You can create a desktop shortcut for quick access.

🛠️ Step 6 — Edit oem.dat for the client

For a single server, you can use the Create Oem.dat button in EasySetupEO. For multiple servers, open the pre-made oem.dat included in the pack and edit it manually.

  1. Open C:\MultipleClassicServer\oem.dat with Notepad.
  2. For each entry (Server1/Ip1/ServerName1, etc.), change the server name, IP, and Login Port (the port you set in EasySetupEO).
  3. Save and copy the file to your client: Client\ini\oem.dat (overwrite).

🎮 Step 5 — Happy Gaming!

  1. Make sure your generated Oem.dat are copied into the client folder (Client\ini\).
  2. Launch the client, pick your server, and log in. Have fun!

Important Warning

Do not rename any files or folders from the server/client pack. Keeping original names ensures this tutorial works correctly.

Antivirus Exclusion & Restore

  • Add an antivirus/Defender exclusion for your server folder (e.g. C:\MultipleClassicServer\) to prevent .exe files from being removed.
  • If an executable gets deleted, Look for exebackup.zip in AccountServer or GameServer, extract it back, and run the server as usual.

⬇️ Other Downloads

  • Flash Player Installer — if the game window shows a blank/black screen when opening.
  • .NET 8 Runtime / Desktop Runtime x64
  • .NET 8 Runtime / Desktop Runtime x32
